In this notebook we analyze the second "think/believe" task, in which participants completed a series of fill-in-the-blanks with free responses. This notebook focuses in particualr on exposure to English.


```{r}
source("./scripts/dependencies.R")
source("./scripts/custom_funs.R")
source("./scripts/var_recode_contrast.R")
source("./scripts/data_prep.R")
```


# Languages spoken

```{r}
d2_lang <- d2 %>% 
  mutate_at(vars(contains("flang"), contains("olang")),
            ~ tolower(.)) %>%
  mutate_at(vars(contains("flang"), contains("olang")),
            ~ sjmisc::set_na(., na = c("\\.", ".", "NA", "mdata", 
                             "missing", "missing data"))) %>%
  mutate(english = case_when(
    grepl("eng", tolower(demo_flang)) |
      grepl("eng", tolower(demo_olang_TEXT)) |
      grepl("eng", tolower(thb2_demo_flang)) |
      grepl("eng", tolower(thb2_demo_olang_1_TEXT)) ~ "English",
    is.na(demo_flang) & is.na(demo_olang_TEXT) &
      is.na(thb2_demo_flang) & is.na(thb2_demo_olang_1_TEXT) ~ NA_character_,
    TRUE ~ "No English"))
```

```{r}
d2_lang %>%
  count(country, english) %>%
  spread(english, n) %>%
  janitor::adorn_totals("row") %>%
  kable() %>%
  kable_styling()
```

## Plots

```{r}
four_cols2 <- c(gg_color_hue(2), "khaki", "gray")
```

```{r, fig.width = 2.8, fig.asp = 0.7}
# after cogsci 2020 submission
d2_long %>%
  # left_join(sample_size_d2) %>%
  left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(english),
         !(country == "US" & english == "No English"),
         !(country == "China" & english == "No English")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = factor(super_cat, 
                        labels = c("relig.", "fact.")), 
             # put NAs on top of bar
             fill = factor(responseX_cat4,
                           levels = c(NA, "other response", "know*", "think*",  
                                      "believe*"), 
                           exclude = NULL))) +
  facet_grid(. ~ english, scales = "free", space = "free") +
  geom_bar(position = "fill", alpha = 0.7, color = "black", size = 0.1) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = four_cols2[c(4:3, 1:2)]) +
  # geom_hline(yintercept = 0.5, lty = 2) +
  theme(#axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, vjust = 1),
        legend.position = "top") +
  labs(x = "Question type", y = "Percent of responses", fill = "Response")
```

## Parallel to KW Analysis #1

```{r, echo = T}
# note: using most maximal common random effects structure
r2.6_eng <- lmer(believeX ~ super_cat * country + 
                   # (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   # (1 + super_cat || thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   (1 | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                 # (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj),
                 data = d2_long %>%
                   left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
                   filter(english == "English"))

r2.6_noeng <- lmer(believeX ~ super_cat * country + 
                     # (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                     # (1 + super_cat || thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                     (1 | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   # (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj),
                   data = d2_long %>%
                     left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
                     filter(english == "No English",
                            country %in% c("Ghana", "Thailand", "Vanuatu")) %>%
                     mutate(country = factor(country, 
                                             levels = c("Ghana", "Thailand", 
                                                        "Vanuatu"))),
                   contrasts = list(country = cbind("_gh" = c(1, 0, -1),
                                                    "_th" = c(0, 1, -1))))
```

```{r}
bind_rows(regtab_fun(r2.6_eng, std_beta = F) %>% 
            mutate(Language = "English"),
          regtab_fun(r2.6_noeng, std_beta = F) %>% 
            mutate(Language = "No English")) %>%
  select(Language, everything()) %>%
  regtab_style_fun(row_emph = c(2, 12)) %>%
  collapse_rows(1)
```

## Parallel to KW Analysis #1 (with interaction)

```{r, echo = T}
# note: using most maximal common random effects structure
r2.7 <- lmer(believeX ~ super_cat * country * english + 
               (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
             # (1 + super_cat || thb2_subj) + (1 | question), 
             # (1 | thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
             # (1 + super_cat | thb2_subj),
             data = d2_long %>%
               left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
               mutate(english = factor(english, 
                                       levels = c("English", "No English"))),
             contrasts = list(english = cbind("No Eng. vs. GM" = c(-1, 1))))
```

```{r}
regtab_fun(r2.7) %>%
  regtab_style_fun(row_emph = 2) %>%
  collapse_rows(1)
```

## Parallel to KW Analysis #2

```{r, echo = T}
# note: using random effects structure from Analysis #2 above
r2.9_eng <- lmer(believeX ~ super_cat + 
                   # (1 + super_cat | country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                 # (1 + super_cat || country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                 (1 | country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                 # (1 + super_cat | country/thb2_subj),
                 data = d2_long %>%
                   left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
                   filter(english == "English") %>%
                   mutate(country = factor(country, levels = levels_country)))

r2.9_noeng <- lmer(believeX ~ super_cat + 
                     # (1 + super_cat | country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   # (1 + super_cat || country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   (1 | country/thb2_subj) + (1 | question),
                   # (1 + super_cat | country/thb2_subj),
                   data = d2_long %>%
                     left_join(d2_lang %>% select(thb2_subj, english)) %>%
                     filter(english == "No English",
                            country %in% c("Ghana", "Thailand", "Vanuatu")) %>%
                     mutate(country = factor(country, 
                                             levels = c("Ghana", "Thailand", 
                                                        "Vanuatu"))))
```

```{r}
bind_rows(regtab_fun(r2.9_eng, std_beta = F) %>% 
            mutate(Language = "English"),
          regtab_fun(r2.9_noeng, std_beta = F) %>% 
            mutate(Language = "No English")) %>%
  select(Language, everything()) %>%
  regtab_style_fun(row_emph = c(2, 4)) %>%
  collapse_rows(1)
```
